title: Flag: Svalbard & Jan Mayen

nouns: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design
Two distinct dependencies of Norway. Official name: Svalbard and Jan Mayen Islands.
Two parts of Norway under separate jurisdictions
Svalbard and Jan Mayen is a statistical designation defined by ISO 3166-1 of two parts of Norway under separate jurisdictions -- Svalbard and Jan Mayen.

The flag of Norway is red with an indigo blue Scandinavian cross fimbriated in white that extends to the edges of the flag; the vertical part of the cross is shifted to the hoist side in the style of the Dannebrog, the flag of Denmark.

description: The flag for Svalbard & Jan Mayen, which may show as the letters SJ on some platforms. This is the same flag as Norway.
apple_vendor_description: The Svalbard and Jan Mayen flag emoji, as seen on Apple devices, features the crisp red and white cross design on a deep blue background, meticulously rendered with sharp clarity. Apple's characteristic glossy finish and precise detailing ensure the flag's distinct Nordic cross stands out, conveying national pride or a sense of place. This emoji is a specific visual identifier for the Norwegian archipelago, perfect for travel-themed messages or discussions related to the region.
